headline: Not even North Korea can be bothered to troll Beto
subHeadline: Guests: Drew Pinsky, Walter Kirn, George 'Tyrus' Murdoch, Katherine Timpf, Aishah Hasnie

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP (R), PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: So I'm going to be very calm, because I don't want them going out to the press and saying that I was anything but calm. So I was extremely calm, very much like I am right now. That was so calm. You all saw me minutes later, I was at a news conference. I was extremely calm.  The narrative was I was screaming and ranting and raving. It was terrible.  What was my tone yesterday at the meeting?

utterances.speaker: SARAH SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Very calm.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: What was my attitude yesterday at the meeting?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, she is right in her answer. You were very calm.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I'm an extremely stable genius.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST, THE GREG GUTFELD SHOW
utterances.sentences: You know, he didn't ask me, but I think he is calm.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, it's summer when those old cranky pieces of junk you see on the road start overheating and breaking down.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT DE NIRO, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: You didn't think you were completely going to get away without a [bleep] Trump moment did you?

utterances.speaker: JEFF DANIELS, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: The big gamble is to go all the way to November 2020, which I agree and lose -- it is the end of democracy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, another batch of broken stars suffering from morbid stupidity. As the real movie roles dry up, they fill the gaps with cartoons and remakes as these Beverly Hills basket cases all voice outrage against the orange monster. It's insane what Trump's done to Hollywood. He has scrambled more brains than a bucket of bad acid. So now all they do is spew identical nonsense exchanging one script for another. Look at the transformation.  This was Jim Carrey before Trump.

utterances.speaker: JIM CARREY, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: It was insane. I mean, it was unbelievable. But you know, the penguins were happy. So that's all I care about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is him after Trump.

utterances.speaker: CARREY
utterances.sentences: I can easily re-retire have money and even when I'm older, I can eat my whole fist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow, this was Jeff Daniels before Trump.

utterances.speaker: DANIELS
utterances.sentences: Movies are king, but not really. Television is really coming right into our living rooms in a way that it never has before.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is him after Trump.

utterances.speaker: DANIELS
utterances.sentences: Camera whiskey, we got it here and go get scrap fries to make the wedgie he wants to make an abracadabra. If Jetsons. Boom. Jam bands.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is Robert De Niro before Trump.

utterances.speaker: DE NIRO
utterances.sentences: We're not anti-vaccination, we're just -- we just want safe vaccination.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And this is him after Trump.

utterances.speaker: DE NIRO
utterances.sentences: Parrot, hammock, different looking chalice. I've been fighting in the Navy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is Rosy before Trump.

utterances.speaker: ROSIE O'DONNELL, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: N'yet, sir, n'yet. N'yet. N'yet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is her now.

utterances.speaker: O'DONNELL
utterances.sentences: N'yet, sir, n'yet. N'yet. N'yet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: See. At least she is consistent. Actually, they've always felt this way. Not about Trump per se, but about you.   Trump, after all, it's just a symbol for the rest of America. That vast wasteland in between the rehabs of Malibu and the restaurants of New York.  They hate you. They hate me. They hate everything that doesn't buy the crap they're selling, which is themselves.  Maybe it's time we return the favor. How about an honest tourist guide for Hollywood?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can't decide where to go on your next vacation? How about Hollywood? The land where shallow people who hate their parents seek validation from perverted producers. Where vacuous attention seekers can maintain careers and drug habits while never producing anything good. You want proof? Go see a movie. They suck. Hollywood. Where you can sit in a car for hours on a one mile stretch of road inhaling nothing but exhaust fumes as your soul withers away to tiny nub.  Where you can stroll down the historic Walk of Fame while dodging hustlers, junkies and vagrants who would stab you in the eye for a quarter.  Get accosted by Harvey Weinstein. Have your car parked by a valet who claims he is an actor but hasn't had a role in years which is why he hates your guts.  Meet desperate parents of child actors who would sell their kid's soul for a bit part in a rap video. Gawk at plastic-faced celebrities as they preach about environmental toxins, while simultaneously pumping their bodies with enough silicone to caulk a swimming pool.  Tour sprawling rehabs that service overpriced breaks from self-loathing, as sitcom actors descend that steady staircase into hell. And of course, see timeless stories of romance, pairing older men with younger actresses who could be their daughters, as older actresses are abandoned in nearby canyons. Hollywood. It's for losers, meaning it's not for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nice. All right. It's harsh. It's sad though when you find out people you thought were talented were just lucky and stupid. You realize their intellectual growth stunted the moment they decided to chase the spotlight, actual thoughts were replaced by one refrain "Me, me, me."  So as stardom fades, they return to that barren yard in their brain where wisdom was supposed to be and they find nothing but the same thoughts they had when they were 15. Their opinions are literally childish, but the politicians are right behind them. After the collusion narrative collapsed, the cries for impeachment only increased.

utterances.speaker: REP. JERROLD NADLER (D-NY)
utterances.sentences: The recalcitrance of the President and his lawless behavior is making it more and more difficult to ignore all alternatives including impeachment.

utterances.speaker: REP. STEVE COHEN (D-TN)
utterances.sentences: I see a lot more people believe that impeachable offenses occurred.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI (D-CA)
utterances.sentences: Ignoring subpoenas, obstruction of justice.  Yes, these could be impeachable offenses.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're so dumb, they can't even see how dumb they are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because impeaching Trump isn't just impossible. It's suicidal.  They fail, he is a folk hero. They succeed, he is friggin Paul Bunyan, and then you get Pence. And Pence is not exactly a liberal. The guy is so conservative his flag pin, where's the flag pin?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Meanwhile, how is Trump handling it? Well, he's got bigger issues like when he thought the sun was in his eyes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I thought that was the sun in my eyes. It's these stupid lights, people. I mean, what are we -- what are they doing? Is there any way they can turn those lights down, folks?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Crazy. You've got a thing called the sun. We like the sun better than the artificial lights.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's pro-sun. That's good. And that's a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: That's a lot of people. It looks like the Academy Awards used to look before they decided to go political against us.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Now the Academy Awards is yonk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what that sound is. But I agree completely. But you know, he's had such an easy life.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I had such an easy life. People say, I had such an easy life. Who the hell knew it was going to be this difficult, but I love it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, he's right. Think about how different politics is from real life or his life. In real life, if you were going to meet with someone to discuss work, you wouldn't first publicly accuse him of a crime.  But that's what Nancy did to Trump before that infrastructure meeting. I think he handled it well.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I don't think Nancy Pelosi understands the deal is too complicated, but it's not a complicated deal. She's a mess. Look, let's face it. She doesn't understand it. I don't want to say Crazy Nancy because if I say that you're going to say it's a copy of Crazy Bernie and next don't good. Crazy Nancy. I have been watching her for a long period of time. She's not the same person. She has lost it. It was sad when I watched Nancy all moving the movement from the hands and the craziness. And I watched it.  That's by the way a person that's got some problems.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How can you not reelect that? So all this insanity swirls around him and he is still presiding over good stuff. You've got it boom economy; historically low unemployment, a world in which our enemies feel the gaze of an awakened giant.  But I felt for those farmers at the presser -- that guy behind Trump expected this thing to last maybe 10 minutes, so he thought after drinking that 32-ounce Big Gulp, I'm going to wait to go to the bathroom. Then 10 minutes became 45. A Trump presser it's like a plane on a tarmac you could be there for days. Meanwhile, all the Dems can do is investigate, litigate, hyperventilate. With Hollywood at their side and the media egging them on, it truly is a new movie -- a stop action classic.  A sequel if you will call it Dumb and Dumber and Dumbest of All. Period.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. If you're feeling sick, he will do the trick. Host of the radio show "Dr. Drew Midday Live," Dr. Drew Pinsky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is smart, charming and completely disarming. Author of "Up in the Air" and columnist at "Harper's Magazine," Walter Kirn. She's got 99 problems and she'll tell you every one. Host up "Sincerely, Kat" coming soon to Fox Nation. Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And when he's tired, he rests his head on Canada, former WWE superstar and host of the new show, "'Nuff Said," coming soon to Fox Nation as well, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Everybody has got a new show. All right, Dr. Drew, so much --

utterances.speaker: DREW PINSKY, RADIO SHOW HOST
utterances.sentences: Greg, before we start.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: When he said extremely stable, he is a genius. I just thought of you. I just thought, Greg extremely stable genius.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How can you not enjoy this -- this world isn't such a good place that we could entertain this kind of public roasting. The only reason we can enjoy this is because nothing bad is going on.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: It's uncanny, right? I mean, things are going well. We're having these this horrible rhetorical thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Walter, you look great by the way. I've missed you. WALTER KIRN, NOVELIST/LITERARY CRITIC: Thank you. That's the reason I came.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: In general or about this business?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Well, impeachment. I hear that word. And I think of that Charlie Brown Halloween special, "The Great Pumpkin" where all the kids go out in the pumpkin patch. And they wait because Lucy has told them the great pumpkin is going to appear. That is every liberal in America right now. Out in the pumpkin patch being rained on, catching cold waiting for the great impeachment pumpkin to rise above the horizon. It's never coming.  And I feel sorry. I know a few of them and they're having a difficult time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You work with them.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: I work with them. I've been out working in Hollywood and I can tell you, it's much worse than you think. People who hate Trump a lot can't even hang out with people who just hate Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: You have to be in the same bandwidth in your hatred of Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: And then you have to hate the kids. And you have to give reasons for hitting the kids and then you have to give reasons for hating the kids. I mean, it's conversation.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Then you have hate all the Fox News anchors, too. That's another hate category. You've got to hate Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: You have to hate Greg. You have got to hate me --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it is. Like, it's hatred by connection. You do this show?  Then they'll have to talk to you and tell you not to do this show. How can you do Fox? And then it just -- it keeps moving and moving. And also, it's not about like not liking Trump or what -- you have to be part of the resistance, or you're the enemy.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Anything short of loathing Trump is considered collaborating.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Or normalizing that's the word.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. Normalizing. Kat, do you care to normalize anything?

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: No, I mean, not really.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Actually. I'd like to normalize maybe on a first date, asking them whether they'd consider being buried next to you or not. That one hasn't - - that was just something I was thinking about in the shower the other day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't waste any time. You don't waste any time, do you? GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR: Maybe sit one out, Greg.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Well, if you don't want get -- if you don't want to get buried next to me, why are we even here? You know. I mean --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's a huge commitment, Kat.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, but commitment should matter. I think I'm a catch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right -- even when she is dead.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Did you want me to talk about Trump? Yes, right, Trump?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, talk about Trump.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're overreacting. People are overreacting. I like kind of though, when people hate me for working at Fox News, which many do because then I can just say, "Oh, they hate me because of where I work."  And I don't have to think about any of the other reasons why they might hate me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You get a lot of that, don't you?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, well, I've got stop asking people if they want to be buried next to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Last word to you, Tyrus. Isn't Trump becoming basically America's favorite uncle?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I don't know about that, but I'm shocked you guys have people who are mad at you because you work at Fox News?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It never happens to you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No, because I mean, well, I've got a great card. You're working for -- oh because I'm black, right? Then they don't know what to do.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No, we love that you are gainfully employed and you're not selling drugs. What? What did you say? No, excuse me -- and they blow up. It's just phenomenal like this this secret -- especially in California and that video. Boy, I was rough, but you're kind of dead on. Like it was -- and I grew up in California and it is like that where there's like this secret society of like, "Hey, join the resistance." But there's also this one like, "Hey, Tyrus, you're doing a good job." "Is Greg really that short?" Yes, he is. So it's a way -- I don't think it's as many of the hate. It's just, you're stuck. They are all in one place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You're trying to write a TV show and surrounded by people talking about feelings and voices and stuff. And you know, Trump tweeted something the other day, my God, stop working so we can read it. Like it's a small group. The rest of America is doing just fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a feeling too when people see you and don't like Fox, I don't think they confront you, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No, they don't. What they do is they say, "Oh, you work at Fox."  Yes. "Cool."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A brand new show just added for the "Gutfeld Monologues Live," Saturday, July 20 at Asbury Park, New Jersey at the Paramount Theater.  Tickets are on sale now. Go to ggutfeld.com for ticket information. And I could tell you there will be some tour dates added for this fall.  Details coming soon. Up next, Joe is still up, Beto is still down and I'm still awesome.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: And now, THE GREG GUTFELD SHOW presents, the 2020 Can't-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When you're no longer making a splash, no one cares about your trash. It's called opposition research a common thing and politics.  Someone is running for office. Their opponent hires a firm to dig dirt on them, unless you're Beto. Yes, requests for dirt on Beto have dried up. No one thinks he's a threat anymore. The latest Quinnipiac poll -- I love saying that -- shows Beto tied for eighth place with Amy what's-her-face? Beto was third back in March. Now, at the top, Joe Biden in, second but losing a little, Bernie. But this week, North Korea said Biden was a low IQ idiot. Well, someone is learning from Trump. But not even North Korea can be bothered to troll Beto or de Blasio who has been in the race for a week and Democrats already know that he stinks. He's scored the lowest favorability of all candidates. You see that long bar going in the down direction. That's de Blasio's favorability.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But that's among Democrats -- that's among Democrats.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but if graphs aren't your thing, here's the de Blasio's whose favorability in video form?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hate it when we do that just for a video. RIP Joe. No, that was not -- everything is fine. I'm just making a morbid joke. Walter.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Walter, the can't-idates. What are your thoughts so far of the Democratic field?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Well, first of all, Kim was not saying low IQ individual in Korea, and that was mistranslated.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh really?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: The word that he was using for Biden in Korean means, "The man with eight arms and hands." The octopus.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Really though?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Yes. And in South Korea, it means hair sniffer.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: But now, let's move through the candidates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Pete Buttigieg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Just a month ago, he was mowing lawns in my neighborhood and now he's running for President.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Also, he doesn't resemble Alfred E. Neuman at all. Now he reminds me of that Bob's Big Boy guy with the hamburger.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Now that that's Pete.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: The big boy.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's a Big Boy. What other candidates are there? Kamala Harris. I don't know what to think of her. She's been nowhere. She was the front runner in a lot of what people were talking about earlier. Apparently they have something on her. I don't know. Elizabeth Warren. I think -- I don't want to be nagged scolded and you know, treated like a bad third grader for the rest of my life. Whenever Elizabeth Warren talks to me, I feel like I've done something wrong. I have to apologize. I'm not sufficiently virtuous.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's how I feel whenever anyone talks to me.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: And to her, I just want to say modernize your haircut. Come on. But okay, who is the real front runner though?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Biden.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Besides Biden.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sanders.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Sanders. Sanders just keeps on going. Why are they deserted him? I thought young people loved him. I thought he was the new Beatles. And yet what happened?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's Pete Best.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Now, he is Pete Best.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a little Beatles trivia there, Dr. Drew.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: We just have a problem with aging politicians. We have a real problem. And people don't understand the process of aging is inevitable and inexorable. And these people are entering office at an age when, you know, in my profession, you'd be pulling people aside, go, "Hey, it's time to step out."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am not planning on being alive.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Well, that's a different issue. But we'll have to talk later, Greg. But seriously, I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I thought it was a rash.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Think about it. This is really a problem. I mean, we have we have the age of -- you know, after which you can become President. We have no upper limit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There's no upper limit.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: And we are people that are going to be --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No one's ever said this. You know, we have a lower limit 35. If we said the sky's the limit. You could be you could be Grandma Moses.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Woodrow Wilson ran the country for what a year and a half after massive stroke? His wife did it. I mean, we've never really addressed this issue. We're going to have to because we have people that are in front of our eyes that are developing medical problems. We have to deal with this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We could have a dead President.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Jimmy Carter could be President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, Jimmy Carter. No, he served --

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: No, he served only one term. Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes. There's never been a worse time to be white Democrat.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know what's sad about this, as I was thinking about when the Republicans had the big field, there was a lot of movement. There was a lot of like, intense battles between them. And they were drawing lines in the sand. They were making strong stances and people were making decisions. Like, I'm going to be a Rubio guy. I'm going to be this guy. And it was like you and me, we were making jokes about it. I think Trump could do it. Nah, he can't do it. But everyone was -- we knew everybody involved. Everyone had a voice

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: [Bleep] over.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's like a bunch of people saying, like, I was flipping through channels today. They don't even address them as presidential candidates anymore. They talk about the job they have now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They were like Senator such and such. By the way who is running for President like it's already over. So I mean, this is really -- I mean, I think Biden unless what Dr. D was talking about, Father Time creeps up on him, and he forgets where he's at during his speech. He's got it. I mean, and then that's going to be whoa.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's going to be whoa. Those debates when Biden -- oh, it's going to be scary, Kat. I noticed about these candidates, none of them can see their blind spots.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Clearly, especially not Bill de Blasio.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I mean, de Blasio running for President of the United States is like a hoarder trying to start a home makeover show.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I mean has he been to New York City? I mean, maybe not because he takes motorcades everywhere. But I'm sure if he actually stepped outside for a minute, he'd be like, "Wow, it smells like pee."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And do you know why it smells like pee, Greg? Because there is pee everywhere. I saw a man peeing up the subway stairs once. One time at Port Authority, I saw a man with pants around his ankles rotating in a circle peeing like a lawn sprinkler. These are all facts. The only thing that there's more of them pee is trash. So that should be his campaign slogan. De Blasio, 2020. Pee and trash. Because they have a lot in common except for pee and trash are far more popular than his campaign.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. That is true. It's a very sad, sad sack of people. Up next, the media made Avenatti a household name. Now, he is trash, which is still a household name.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
